channel.title: A Server im trying to play won't open correctly on my linux
channel.description:
so i play many RSPS on my linux, and the desktop clients work perfectly and webclients rarely work. But for some reason when i try to play this server It loads up to the screen i posted in the picture below, and when i run it from the terminal i receive this error message: Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60 java.lang.NullPointerException at client.preloadModels(client.java:229) at client.startUp(client.java:8347) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:84) at client.run(client.java:5290) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Im running on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, using Oracle Java 7 to run it, and i've tried all other versions, and they still give that message. Does anyone know a fix?

item.title: A Server im trying to play won't open correctly on my linux
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“jayseph143, post:5, topic:545985”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664876.msg4444676#msg4444676 date=1408172110]

If you’re not the owner of it, contact the owner. It’s their server and their issue. Not yours.

have contacted him, im the only one with the problem, he has windows not linux.

So what?
You need access to the code in order to fix the error in question.
[/quote]
And someone here with actual knowledge of linux java errors can tell me a fix, if they’ve experienced it. Not someone who only knows windows and is wasting my time by even responding.[/quote]

Has 2 linux computers
Only knows Windows.
Okay. Yeah. Don’t assume. I was telling you the truth, you need access to the source code in order to fix that error, as all that we see is wrong is the error.
We don’t know if it’s because it’s trying to locate a file on the C:\ drive that doesn’t exist, or what. All we know is it’s trying to load, gets to 60%, and then breaks.

Read full topic
item.source: A Server im trying to play won't open correctly on my linux

item.title: A Server im trying to play won't open correctly on my linux
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

The client you are playing was butchered and made OS specific to Windows unfortunately, you need source code access to fix the issue you’re experiencing, he is not wasting your time.

It is not a Java error, it is a code base error. You need to take that up with the owner or have him come here with his source code and ask for help.

Read full topic

And someone here with actual knowledge of linux java errors can tell me a fix, if they’ve experienced it. Not someone who only knows windows and is wasting my time by even responding.

so i play many RSPS on my linux, and the desktop clients work perfectly and webclients rarely work.
But for some reason when i try to play this server It loads up to the screen i posted in the picture below, and when i run it from the terminal i receive this error message:
Map amount = 660Error: loaderror 60

Im running on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS, using Oracle Java 7 to run it, and i’ve tried all other versions, and they still give that message. Does anyone know a fix?
